Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Individualized PEEP in Thoracoscopic Lobectomy

Trial_Design.evidence: Conducted as a single-center, randomized controlled trial, 100 patients scheduled for thoracoscopic lobectomy were randomized

Intervention.evidence: randomized to receive either individualized PEEP guided by maximum dynamic pulmonary compliance or a fixed PEEP of 5 cm H2O

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the impact of individualized positive end-expiratory pressure (PEEP) titrated to maximum dynamic lung compliance on postoperative pulmonary complications (PPCs)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of PPCs within seven days post-surgery

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was achieved using SPSS-generated sequences with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes

Blinding.evidence: Patients, data managers, and statistical analysts were blinded

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between October 2022 and October 2023, 100 patients were randomized: 50 to the individualized PEEP group and 50 to the control group

Result_Outcome.evidence: PPCs occurred in 20% of the individualized group versus 38% in the control group (risk difference, -18.0%; 95% CI, -35.4% to -0.6%; p = 0.047)

Harms.evidence: No severe adverse events were reported
